main event: On 25 January 1953, radar and visual observations were made of an unidentified aerial phenomenon over the Continental Divide, New Mexico.
interesting points: The object was tracked by radar traveling at speeds up to 12,000 - 15,000 mph.,Multiple witnesses, including Air Force personnel, observed the object visually.,The sighting lasted approximately 15 minutes.,The object was estimated to be 60 to 100 feet long and displayed an erratic flight path.,Weather balloons were released in the area on the sighting dates, but the characteristics of the observed object did not align with typical balloon behavior.
sighted object: a bright reddish-white object moving erratically
witness description: Air Force personnel stationed at a radar site
